alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:04PM EST until January 26 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Griffin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to occur. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 12.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 10.0 feet Saturday evening. It will rise to 10.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall to 9.8 feet Monday evening. It will rise to 10.2 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM EST.
